Hit Points.Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per ranger level after 1st

Proficiencies.Skills: Choose three from Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Nature, Perception, Stealth, and Survival

Equipment: a scale mail or leather armor
two shortswords or two simple melee weapons
a dungeoneer's pack or an explorer's pack
a longbow and a quiver of 20 arrows

Class Features.name: Favored Enemy
Class Features.desc: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy. You choose a type of favored enemy and gain advantages on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track them and Intelligence checks to recall information about them. You also learn one language spoken by your favored enemies.

Class Features.name: Natural Explorer
Class Features.desc: At 1st level, you are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and gain benefits when traveling in that region. You gain advantages on checks related to your favored terrain, difficult terrain doesn't slow your group, you can’t become lost except by magical means, and you remain alert to danger while traveling.

Class Features.name: Deft Explorer (Optional)
Class Features.desc: You gain benefits such as doubled proficiency bonus for a chosen skill, the ability to speak, read, and write two additional languages, an increased walking speed, climbing and swimming speeds, and the ability to gain temporary hit points and decrease exhaustion levels.

Class Features.name: Fighting Style
Class Features.desc: You adopt a particular style of fighting. Choose one of the following options: Archery, Defense, Dueling, or Two-Weapon Fighting.

Class Features.name: Spellcasting
Class Features.desc: You can use the magical essence of nature to cast spells. Your spellcasting ability is Wisdom, and you use it to determine spell save DC and attack rolls. You have a number of spell slots as shown on the Ranger table and can learn and replace ranger spells as you gain levels.

Class Features.name: Primeval Awareness
Class Features.desc: Beginning at 3rd level, you can use a ranger spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot, you can sense the presence of certain types of creatures within a specified distance.

Class Features.name: Primal Awareness (Optional)
Class Features.desc: You learn additional spells that don’t count against the number of ranger spells you know. These spells are gained at specific levels.

Class Features.name: Ability Score Improvement
Class Features.desc: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

Class Features.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
Class Features.desc: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to rangers.

Class Features.name: Extra Attack
Class Features.desc: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Class Features.name: Land's Stride
Class Features.desc: At 8th level, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and have advantage on saving throws against magical plants.

Class Features.name: Hide in Plain Sight
Class Features.desc: At 10th level, you can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks while camouflaged.

Class Features.name: Nature's Veil (Optional)
Class Features.desc: You can use a bonus action to magically become invisible for a short duration.

Class Features.name: Vanish
Class Features.desc: At 14th level, you can use the Hide action as a bonus action and can’t be tracked by nonmagical means.

Class Features.name: Feral Senses
Class Features.desc: At 18th level, you gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can’t see. You are aware of the location of any invisible creature within 30 feet of you.

Class Features.name: Foe Slayer
Class Features.desc: At 20th level, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your favored enemies.
